ygData.subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Digest Number 374
ygData.msgSnippet: Oh yeah forgot about lava storm.  Group with a druid.  They have snare and you can use your fear spell.  You will find that in outdoor zones Ranger/Enchanter,
ygData.messageBody:
Oh yeah forgot about lava storm. Group with a druid. They have snare and
you can use your fear spell. You will find that in outdoor zones
Ranger/Enchanter, Druid/Enchanter, Shadow Knight/Enchanter and to a lesser
extent Necromancer/Enchanter (because the necro really doesn't need you) all
these combinations are great. My favorite is actually Ranger/Enchanter
because there is allways a ranger out there looking for a group. Let the
Ranger snare and you fear, make sure the Ranger backs out when fear is off
or your down time will increase quite a bit while he tries to heal himself
after fights.

Mu

I know all of this is the opposite of what I told you about grouping in
dungeons to learn, but this is very good exp too. Not so much at your lvl,
but after 29 or so when outdoor mobs start having enough HPS to make it
worth while to use the mana on fearing them.

-----Original Message-----
From: ansonidak [mailto:ansonidak@...]
Sent: Saturday, June 23, 2001 3:09 AM
To: eqenchanters@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Digest Number 374


At level 14 you might take your group up to lavastorm mountains. Its not as
heavily hunted and ideal for your level group. You might try sticking your
head in najena and trying the mobs near the entrance. I agree strongly with
the previous respondent about getting into dungeons as much as possible.
Practice your crowd control skills You'll be glad you did later in life.
Seeing a dungeon floor littered with enemy corpses and knowing you were
the difference between this outcome and a party wipeout/evac is quite a
thrill :)

Sandoz Pharmacueticals
lvl 54 (the hard way) chanter
Torvonnilious
semi-retired (battle fatigue, psychosis situational)


>
> Hi all, i've not introduced myself... just joined this list last week and
> as there haven't been any posts.. well, that's my reason for not doing it
> before now :o)
> I've only just started playing EQ in the last few weeks, i'm a Gnome
> Enchantress on The Rathe server.
> Doing pretty well, I'm lvl 14 now and a large loan from a friend has
> ensured that I've been able to get almost all my spells and lots of decent
> kit :o)
> Anyway, so far I've played... in North Freeport for the first few lvl's,
> Misty Thicket up till 7 or 8, then West Commons up until now, killing
> Dervs. I've pretty much stopped getting exp from killing them now (in
> groups of 6 usually), so have been dumped in Oasis... but so far
everything
> iv'e come across is green or red :o(
> Does anyone have any tips for the best place to be located at this
> lvl? Obviously I'd like to get to 16 soon to get breeze but at the rate
> I'm going, I'm either going to not move from low lvl 14, or go down to 13
> if I get killed any more in oasis :o(
> Thanks a lot,
